customer_addr:
S 2986 GARNER HILL RD
HILLSBORO, WI 54634

citations.narrative:
A red male poodle no longer had his tag (#101). The representative looked for it but couldn't find the tag. Identification
can be important for animal health and husbandry tracking. Ensure that this dog's tag is found or assign it a replacement
tag so that it is properly identified.
***Correct by 5/29/2023.

The exercise area (by the north walk-in gate) has some strands of loose wire and wire points that the dogs could contact
when let out into it. Wire strands and points could hurt dogs. Ensure to maintain surfaces free from edges or points that
could injure the animals.
***Correct by 5/16/2023.

A bag in the shavings storage shed has bird droppings on it. It appears that there is a nest above the bag.
Contamination of bedding/shavings with bird droppings could make dogs sick. Ensure to protect shavings from
contamination by storing them in an area where they won't get bird droppings on the bags.
***Correct by 5/17/2023.

The last physical exams of adults from the Attending Veterinarian were noted on 1/3/2022. The representatives said that
the noted wellness checks on 1/3/2022 were the last time physical exams by the attending veterinarian were done.
Yearly physical exams on each dog are required and help ensure each dog is healthy. Ensure that a complete physical
examination from head to tail of each dog by the attending veterinarian is completed.
***Correct by 6/16/2023.

The facility representative said that the veterinarian has done rabies vaccinations for adults but a schedule for parvo and
distemper vaccination has not been followed for adults (puppies are being vaccinated per records). Also, the written
program of veterinary care does not address sampling for heartworm and fecal sampling for adult dogs. Vaccination for
parvo and distemper is required for adult dogs and helps protect the facility from these diseases. Sampling for heartworm
and fecal sampling of adults is required and helps ensure the facility is preventing parasites. Ensure to follow the
attending veterinarian's program of vaccination and contact the attending veterinarian to update the sampling plan for
heartworm and fecal tests and then follow the program of sampling.
***Correct by 6/16/2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
2.50 
   
Time and method of identification. 
A red male poodle no longer had his tag (#101). The representative looked for it but couldn't find the tag.  Identification 
can be important for animal health and husbandry tracking.  Ensure that this dog's tag is found or assign it a replacement 
tag so that it is properly identified.  
***Correct by 5/29/2023. 
3.1(c)(1)(ii) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
The exercise area (by the north walk-in gate) has some strands of loose wire and wire points that the dogs could contact 
when let out into it.  Wire strands and points could hurt dogs.  Ensure to maintain surfaces free from edges or points that 
could injure the animals.  
***Correct by 5/16/2023. 
3.1(e) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
A bag in the shavings storage shed has bird droppings on it.  It appears that there is a nest above the bag.  
Contamination of bedding/shavings with bird droppings could make dogs sick.  Ensure to protect shavings from

contamination by storing them in an area where they won't get bird droppings on the bags.  
***Correct by 5/17/2023. 
3.13(a)(2) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The last physical exams of adults from the Attending Veterinarian were noted on 1/3/2022.  The representatives said that 
the noted wellness checks on 1/3/2022 were the last time physical exams by the attending veterinarian were done.  
Yearly physical exams on each dog are required and help ensure each dog is healthy.  Ensure that a complete physical 
examination from head to tail of each dog by the attending veterinarian is completed. 
***Correct by 6/16/2023. 
3.13(a)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The facility representative said that the veterinarian has done rabies vaccinations for adults but a schedule for parvo and 
distemper  vaccination has not been followed for adults (puppies are being vaccinated per records).  Also, the written 
program of veterinary care does not address sampling for heartworm and fecal sampling for adult dogs.  Vaccination for 
parvo and distemper is required for adult dogs and helps protect the facility from these diseases.  Sampling for heartworm 
and fecal sampling of adults is required and helps ensure the facility is preventing parasites.  Ensure to follow the 
attending veterinarian's program of vaccination and contact the attending veterinarian to update the sampling plan for 
heartworm and fecal tests and then follow the program of sampling.  
***Correct by 6/16/2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
